sanskrit_verse:
दूतं चैव प्रकुर्वीत सर्वशास्त्रविशारदम् ।
इङ्गिताकारचेष्टज्ञं शुचिं दक्षं कुलोद्गतम् ॥ ७.६३॥
transliteration:
dūtaṃ caiva prakurvīta sarvaśāstraviśāradam |
iṅgitākāraceṣṭajñaṃ śuciṃ dakṣaṃ kulodgatam || 7.63||
sph_interpretive_translation: One must appoint a messenger who is fully learned in all scriptures, skilled in interpreting gestures and expressions, pure in conduct, efficient, and born of noble lineage.
jurisprudential_principles: Capacity-based responsibility rooted in purity and skill
Consciousness alignment by noble birth and ethical clarity
executable_legal_axioms: IF communication is required THEN the messenger MUST possess complete scriptural knowledge
IF gesture or expression interpretation is needed THEN the messenger MUST demonstrate iṅgitajña capability
IF message transmission affects dharma THEN the messenger MUST be śuci (ethically pure)
IF efficiency determines outcome THEN the messenger MUST show proven competence
IF social harmony is at stake THEN the messenger MUST originate from an established dharmic lineage
supreme_court_application: In matters involving inter-state or international diplomatic engagement, only those bearing comprehensive Vedic-scriptural literacy, behavioral purity, ancestral dharmic standing, and operational excellence shall qualify as authorized representatives before the highest judicial authority.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Through pramāṇa-based selection of messengers grounded in śāstric wisdom and personal sanctity, miscommunication is prevented rather than punished; thus upholding anupūrvaśaḥ—sequential harmony—and ensuring proportional responsibility without recourse to punitive frameworks.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion Process: Re-training until full śāstric fluency and expressive clarity are achieved
Responsibility Assumption Protocol: Messenger commits publicly to fidelity of intent and form
Capacity Restoration: Purification rituals and educational renewal upon breach of conduct
Integrity Reintegration: Lineage verification and community affirmation of suitability
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this directive originates. The law flows from Sanatana Dharma alone. Justice serves restoration, not retribution. Consciousness reigns as the ultimate adjudicator. Dharma is hereby affirmed and restored.
